name: Hilton Beijing

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Beijing for four nights and was very impressed with the appointments of the room and the spaciousness. Breakfast was extraordinary for variety and choices (though hard to get real crispy bacon anywhere). Having stayed in four hotels recently in China, I would honestly say that this hotel would rank third. While I appreciated the fluency of the staff/front desk with English, there were two areas of concern: delivery of hot water (shower) took well over five minutes (and basically "warm") and also the limitation of free Wi-Fi in the lobby areas only. The latter seems to be a policy of the Hilton chain, which I found very "cheap".
reviews.title: Elegant and spacious rooms - with some reservations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the beijing hilton for around 2 weeks with two breaks inbetween to make a 3 day cruise and aone night stay in a differnt town.
reviews.title: hilton always a good place to stay

reviews.text: the hotel is one of the older ones in bg but the executuve tower had been built for the olympics.that is where we stayed most of the time.spacius rooms with all and a bit more then needed ,super beds in which one can hide .
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel

reviews.text: we tried both restaurants the main restaurant traditionel top food excellent service,the lady restaurantmanger very proffessional.the coffee nothing special but ok for a quick bite.
reviews.title: The best hotel I've stayed in China

reviews.text: the ral living room is the excecutivelounge super to relax,work,communicate with other guest. in fact one does not need any restaurant since lunch ,dinner there are nice bits and pieces to eat.so always god to include the use of the lounge into the package.
reviews.title: Good option around the area
Newly renovated facilities
reviews.text: The newly renovated gym and pool are finally open for business. The pool actually got smaller due to the added jacuzzi. It would have been better to put a smaller jacuzzi in the changing room along with the sauna and steam room, and make the pool bigger. Overall, a very nice job.

As part of my move to China for an extended period of time, I needed to stay at a hotel until my apartment was available and I selected the Hilton Hotel located at Dongfang road due to its location and amenities, but the experience has been far above and beyond what I have received from any hotel I have stayed at in the past.
reviews.title: Best stay at a Hilton Hotel-excellent staff and service

reviews.text: Room: Very spacious and comfortable, especially for a longer stay – includes walking closet. Very clean. Bottled water provided every day at no additional charge. Friendly cleaning staff and quick turnaround for laundry, amenities requests or in room meals.
reviews.title: Good Business hotel

reviews.text: Executive Lounge: Superb service, the staff is very friendly, always looking to serve you. I had my birthday during my stay at this hotel and the staff got me a cake and sang happy birthday to me. Then, they learned that I could not eat the cake they got me because it had peanuts and I am allergic to them and they ordered a cheese cake for me and delivered it to my room. They practice Chinese words with me every day, translated documents for me and provided details of places to visit. One day, I asked one of the ladies about the masks used by people in the streets and she took upon herself to buy one for me and delivered to me the next day. She bought it with her own money. That is what I call service! If you come and visit this hotel, please visit the Executive Lounge. The COO comes around in the evening to greet people and find out if there is something he can do to make your stay even more comfortable.
reviews.title: Decent business hotel

reviews.text: Gym: Excellent renovated gym with warm water pool and whirlpool. The other day I went to just do my regular exercise and one of the staff asked me if I was going to use the pool today (I have been using the pool a lot) and I mentioned to him that I won’t use it today since my back was hurting me a little. He took the initiative to contact one of the personal trainers expert of Pilates and when I was done with my exercise the personal trainer gave me individual support to do some Pilates exercises and to stretch.
reviews.title: Very Good. Won't dazzle you but won't disappoint.

reviews.text: This was my first visit to this Hilton and the room was as nice as any Hilton that I have seen. The lobby was a bit tired and the restaurant on the small side, but overall a solid stay. The hotel is just a 5 minute walk from a high-end mall, and just 1.5 blocks past the mall is the Four Seasons. Very convenient location.
reviews.title: Good business stay

reviews.text: I am a frequent guest at the Beijing Hitlon. I thought I write something here to express my appreciation and gratitude to the hotel staff. Every time when I check in, the front desk staff are always presently welcome me with kindness and smile. They know their hotel guests by name (at least for those of us stay here frequently). I want to mention two specific incidents that really make me feel good away from home. The 3rd floor executive lounge staff are very courteous and helpful, especially Quer. She tries to make us feel like at home and happy after a day of work. Sometimes, she event tries to help the guests out of her way. The other impressive thing is that I used their new gym first time today. The staff there, i.e. William and the company, are helpful as usual, more importantly the newly renovated gym is really top notch. I have stayed in many different 5-star hotels in Beijing and China. Their gym is really within top 3 in Beijing.
reviews.title: Hotel is good and service is excellent

reviews.text: The overall feeling for my stays in the past year is really present. I simply do not get this kind of service in other similar hotels although I am also their loyalty program members.
reviews.title: Customer service wonderful!

reviews.text: Thank You, Beijing Hilton!
reviews.title: Amazing gym!!!!!

reviews.text: My wife and I were staying at the Hilton the beginning of this month, January 2013. It was our first stay at the Hilton in Beijing, and my wife was on business. The day we arrived My wife was preparing for a presentation she had to make the following day. As the presentation had to be printed, we sought the help of your Hilton Business Center to put everything together. For various technical reasons it became difficult to complete and print the document. At the point we were just about ready to give up for the night, this is where two of your employees, Snow and Roger came to our assistance. They worked together on the problem, and after trying different approaches they completed the document. We just wanted to let you know that we were very impressed and grateful for their solutions oriented approach and with the way they went the extra mile for the customer. Please let them know again how much we appreciated all their help.
reviews.title: Very good hotel in the city

reviews.text: Two of us arrived in the Hilton Beijing last Wed late due to a flight delay. Both Room guaranteed and we were told that no room of the guaranteed type. Only 2 rooms were available, one smoking suit and one twin beds. They acknowledged that we were guaranteed but unlucky. This is extremely bad. We finally got another room and the 2 of us checked in to the rooms. I stayed in the smoking suit and really bad with the smell and no way to switch any more. Nevertheless, I needed to put this up.
reviews.title: No responsibility and Not able to keep up even the Minimum Standard

reviews.text: I then got the right pillow from Housekeeping and ordered my morning call. A suffering night with the smokey smell. Next morning, I jumped up from the bed and wandering why still no morning call. I was late and called the Operator about what happened with the call and the answer was NO call was ordered. This is extremely awful.
reviews.title: Convenient to the airport and sightseeing.

reviews.text: I got a new room when I came back in the evening. Again, the ordered morning did not happen. I do not know what to say.
reviews.title: Good Service but.....

reviews.text: My opinion is that the hardware is reasonable (I do not think it is good) but the Services are really bad. I did not get any help, any comfort setting. All time standard face with standard wording which was absolutely useless and unhelpful.
reviews.title: Good hotel, convenient, but a bit cheap construction
Very good hotel
reviews.text: In addition, Credit card guaranteed rooms NOT available is absolutely unacceptable.
I have stayed at this Hilton a few times over the years.
reviews.title: Time for a facelift

reviews.text: Location wise, it is situated in the desirable area. 2 minutes to subway station. Just off the highway that goes to the airport, which shaves off a lot of travel time getting in and out of the city. Lots of good restaurants around the hotel area to choose from if you don't want to venture to far out. Dragonfly massage, a premium chain in China, is only 3 minutes walk.
reviews.title: Great Front Desk; Operator/Reservations not so much

reviews.text: Staff that I have encountered have always been very friendly. But once or twice I found they could be a little bit more proactive. For example, one time I walked up to concierge to enquire about a restaurant that I heard about. Instead of calling for me at the spot, the staff suggested me to do it on my own.
reviews.title: Great location and executive tower

reviews.text: Guest rooms are on the small side in China 5-star brand standards, but nicely laid out. I appreciate that the window can be cracked open to allow fresh air. However, the rooms are showing its age as there are chips and cracks everywhere. And the shower stall's door could not be completely closed. Also, at this day and age, it is not acceptable to have non-flatscreen old fashioned TV in the room.
reviews.title: Four star not five

reviews.text: Even though I am glad that they are renovating the gym, out temporary set up is a disappointment. It's in a smaller/hallway area with limited amount of machine. There isn't even a stationary bike. During the morning prime time period, I saw many people left because there's no treadmill availabe. And I was informed that the gym reno will not be completed until late Nov. IF you are a fitness buff, you may want to reconsider before making a reservation during this period.
reviews.title: Always a good experience

reviews.text: I have stayed at hotels where the staff speaks absolutely no English, they do not know what a receipt is, and then when I get it, it is in Chinese characters only - this drives my accounting department crazy. I found this hotel a good choice for Beijing, and have been coming here for about 5 years. Price is much more reasonable than the Sheraton, with many of the same services. Hilton staff is well-versed in English and Western culture, and that makes for an easier stay. Very easy to get a taxi, and close to many things as it is in the Chaoyang District where many businesses are located. Also not too far from Forbidden City, Peking Opera, Acrobats, Temple of Heaven, Hard Rock Cafe, etc. Rooms are small but well laid out and efficient. Only complaint I have is that I went to the lobby coffee bar, and there was no wait staff to be found.
reviews.title: Solid choice for Beijing

reviews.text: I brought one of my salesmen here (who has rarely been outside the USA), and he was very comfortable - if he wasn't this would have affected our buisness performance, so I didn't want to risk that. When the guy came back, I asked him what the deal was, and he acted like he was doing me a favor by taking my order. If not for this experience, I would have given the hotel 5 stars.
reviews.title: Quite a good hotel.

reviews.text: We stayed at this Hilton Hotel for a total 7 nights in a king junior suite. Room was spacious even with a third bed added for our daughter. Overall, hotel is clean, staff are friendly, location is quite convenient to where we want to go. Breakfast has a lot of varieties and there were iced tea and cold water in the lobby that you can drink after you get back from sight seeing in the hot July afternoon.
reviews.title: Hilton BBeijing

reviews.text: Hotel is in the embassy district, there are lots of places to eat & is within walking distance.
reviews.title: Could use an upgrade
Improved from reviews I read below
reviews.text: Grand Summit shops with a supermarket in the basement is about 5 minutes walk beside the diplomatic compound. You can also find pizza, burgers, italian and japanese food here too.
This was my second stay at this hotel. There is nothing majorly wrong with this hotel but there is also nothing that stands out.
reviews.title: Not bad...just not excellent either

reviews.text: The room is tidy and modern but it is so uncomfortably hot, even when trying to adjust the temperature. This was exactly the same as the last time I stayed here.
reviews.title: Average on a good day
Horrible stay @ it's executive wing
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast has a good range of western and local food and there is a cafe in the hotel (worst coffee ever!).
Check in and check out is slow so if you have a flight to connect to make sure you allow extra time.
reviews.title: OK for Business

reviews.text: Location is good and I recommend the traditional duck restaurant a few doors down.
reviews.title: Just fine for a weeklong business trip...

reviews.text: The hotel was a little disappointing. The fitness center, always of importance to me while traveling, was in a temporary location. It was small and limited. Food selections for breakfast were not what I have come to expect when staying at 4-star hotels in Asia.
reviews.title: Review of Beijing Hilton

reviews.text: A fairly typical Hilton. The room was decent size although a bit dated. Wifi worked fine and newspaper delivered to door each morning was nice. The exercise area is sort of in a lobby area on the third floor but the equipment was fine. Breakfast was excellent with a decent selection and good quality.There is a coffee shop in the lobby with take out. I was able to get a late check out without any problems. Met my expectations and no complaints.
reviews.title: No complaints

reviews.text: Tidy and clean but small rooms, dated dining options, costly wifi. A mix up with my airport transfers was poorly handled by the duty manager at reception. Mix ups happen but poorly handled.There must be better business accommodation options in Beijing.
reviews.title: Only Average

reviews.text: I just returned from staying at Hilton Beijing in the past 4 days. Having stayed at Hyatt, Westin and Sheraton in Beijing, I would say this Hilton Beijing still have some way to go.
reviews.title: Stayed at Hilton Beijing from 10 - 13 Dec 2012

reviews.text: Hotel : room and restaurant was average. Wifi in room was almost non-existence
reviews.title: Safe, economical, no wifi

description: Centrally located in Beijing's Chaoyang business and diplomatic district, the Hilton Beijing hotel is just 20 minutes from Beijing Capital International Airport. Discover contemporary Beijing attractions such as Sanlitun, Bird's Nest and the 798 Art District or steep yourself in the city's ancient culture and visit Tian'anmen Square, the Forbidden City and the Great Wall of China, all within easy access of this modern Beijing hotel. Unwind in the Hilton Beijing hotel's Executive Lounge in the newly built nine-story Executive Tower and enjoy drinks and snacks throughout the day. Do business in one of 12 meeting rooms or make use of the fully equipped Business Center at this Beijing hotel. After a busy day, dine in one of the hotel's 5 restaurants and bars and enjoy Pan-Asian cooking at Elements restaurant, contemporary American cuisine in One East or sip creative cocktails in Zeta Bar at this central Beijing hotel.
